channel.title: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle Stories

item.title: 'I’ve never identified as a "daddy’s little princess" type of girl': Married women reveal why they walked themselves down the aisle on their wedding days - just like royal bride Meghan Markle
item.description: Leah Melby Clinton, Abby Sherwood, and Mallory Cooke shared the reasons why they opted to walk themselves down the aisle on their wedding days, and they all believe they made the right decision.
item.dc:abstract: Three married women have revealed the reasons why they decided to buck tradition and walk themselves down the aisle on their wedding days — and they all believe they made the right decision. New Yorker Leah Melby Clinton, 32, said she walked down the aisle solo because her parents divorced when she was young, and she didn't want to hurt either of their feelings. Meanwhile, 33-year-old Abby Sherwood's parents didn't support her decision to marry her wife due to religious reasons, so she walked herself down the aisle. For Mallory Cooke, 31, who is from Tennessee, the decision to walk by herself was about keeping her late father's memory alive. At her wedding to Prince Harry, Meghan, 36, walked down the first half of the aisle by herself, before she was joined by Prince Charles.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Three brides reveal why they walked themselves down the aisle

item.title: A right royal sleepover! The Queen and Meghan will travel to Cheshire together OVERNIGHT on board the monarch’s official train ahead of their day of engagements
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: The monarch has invited Meghan to accompany her for a day of engagements on Thursday and MailOnline understands that the pair will travel together overnight.
item.dc:abstract: EXCLUSIVE: The monarch has invited Meghan to accompany her for a day of engagements on Thursday and MailOnline understands that the pair will travel together on the royal train (right) overnight. Only the most senior members of the Royal Family – namely the Queen, Prince Philip, Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall - are entitled to use it. Not even Meghan’s husband, Prince Harry, or the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge are ever believed to have used it in an official capacity.
item.dc:creator: Sebastian Murphy-Bates
item.mi:shortTitle: Queen invites Meghan onto her train – an honour Harry isn’t afforded

item.title: The moment we’ve been waiting for! Harry and Meghan to make their first Buckingham Palace balcony appearance when they join the royal family for Trooping the Colour on Saturday
item.description: Prince Harry and Meghan are expected to join the Queen and other members of the royal family for the military parade in London. It will be their first appearance since their honeymoon.
item.dc:abstract: Prince Harry and Meghan (left, on their wedding day) are expected to join the Queen and other members of the royal family (right, at last year's Trooping the Colour) for the military parade in London. This will be the new Duke and Duchess of Sussex's first public appearance since their honeymoon. Unlike the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, Harry, 33, and Meghan, 36, did not share a traditional kiss on the Buckingham Palace balcony on the big day after choosing Windsor as their venue.
item.dc:creator: Emily Chan
item.mi:shortTitle: Harry and Meghan to make first Buckingham Palace balcony appearance

item.title: PIERS MORGAN: Why Meghan, Harry and the clueless Palace may come to rue the day they left the backstabbing, money-grabbing Markles out in the cold and turned this wedding into a right royal tacky mess
item.description: What a mess! Weddings are supposed to be wonderful occasions filled with love, romance and good cheer. Fat chance of that with Meghan and Harry's, which has swiftly descended into a fiasco.
item.dc:abstract: What a mess. Weddings are supposed to be wonderfully positive occasions filled with love, romance and good cheer. Fat chance of that with Prince Harry and Meghan Markle’s wedding, which has swiftly descended into an acrimonious, disorganised fiasco - and there are still three long days until the big day. Most of the blame for this falls on Meghan’s family, who’ve conspired to behave like a bunch of repulsive PR-crazed Kardashians, exploiting their girl’s royal romance for as much money and residual fame as they can squeeze out of it.
item.dc:creator: Katherine Thomson
item.mi:shortTitle: PIERS: The Palace has let the Markles turn this wedding into a mess

item.title: EXCLUSIVE: Meghan Markle's ancestors' life as Jazz Age stars and a baseball great revealed - How her family tree includes cross-dressing jazz performer who toured Europe and player who faced Babe Ruth
item.description: Meghan Markle's family story takes a new twist as DailyMail.com reveals how she is related to one of the greatest black baseball players and two black Jazz Age performers, one who posed as a man.
item.dc:abstract: Meghan Markle's family story takes a new twist as DailyMail.com reveals how her mother Doria's family includes William 'Happy' Evans Jr (left), a baseball great who played against baby Ruth and Lou Gehrig. The ball player's father William Demont Evans and his wife Lillyn Brown (right) were jazz Age great. She toured Europe, sang the blues and daringly performed frequently as a man, revealing that she was a woman at the end of the act by pulling off her top hat. The ball player died when Meghan was five but her mom Doria's great-aunt Lillie, his wife, died when the Duchess of Sussex was 22 and Doria lives in the Los Angeles house Lillie Evans bought.
item.dc:creator: Hugh Dougherty
item.mi:shortTitle: Meghan Markle's ancestors: cross-dressing jazz star and baseball great

item.title: Will self-proclaimed feminist Meghan change the law to allow for a female heir? Duke and Duchess of Sussex's future daughters cannot inherit titles because current legislation only allows dukedoms to pass to men
item.description: Only a male heir can inherit the dukedom - so when Prince Harry died, the title Duke of Sussex will go on to his son, regardless of whether the son is his first-born.
item.dc:abstract: When Meghan Markle and Prince Harry said 'I do' last month, the queen named them the Duke and Duchess of Sussex. But dukedom can only be inherited by male children — not female — regardless of birth order. So if Harry and Meghan — who are rumored to want to start a family right away — welcome a boy as their first child, he will one day inherit his dad's title, Duke of Sussex. But if there first child is a girl, she will simply be called 'Lady'. In 2013, the Succession to the Crown Act changed the law regarding succession to the throne so it is based on birth order, regardless of gender. This means that William and Kate's daughter, Princess Charlotte, follows her older brother George in the line of succession to the throne, however that law applies to those in line for the crown, not members of the peerage.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Prince Harry & Meghan's future daughter won't inherit a title

item.title: Her Majesty’s new right hand woman! Newlywed Meghan will accompany the Queen on a whirlwind day of engagements in Chester next week – in her first royal outing WITHOUT Harry
item.description: The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in Chester next Thursday. They will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge.
item.dc:abstract: The new Duchess of Sussex, 36, will be joining the 92-year-old monarch to open the Storyhouse Theatre and attend a lunch in Chester next Thursday. The pair will also open the Mersey Gateway Bridge in Widnes, Cheshire, on the same day.
item.dc:creator: Emily Chan
item.mi:shortTitle: Meghan will conduct first joint engagement with Queen in Chester

item.title: Moving on! Meghan Markle's chef ex is 'expecting his first child' with his singer girlfriend - days after her ex-husband revealed he is engaged again
item.description: Meghan dated chef Cory Vitiello (main) after her split with ex-husband Trevor Engelson. Cory is reportedly expecting a child with his girlfriend, Martina Sorbara (inset).
item.dc:abstract: Meghan dated chef Cory Vitiello (right) after her split with ex-husband Trevor Engelson and before she met Prince Harry. Cory is reportedly expecting a child with his girlfriend, Martina Sorbara. US Weekly reports the 38-year-old chef is expecting a child with Martina Sorbara (left), 39, who is a singer for the Canadian electro band Dragonette. This news comes just two days after it was revealed that Meghan's ex-husband Trevor Engelson asked for his girlfriend, dietitian Tracey Kurland, to marry him. Meghan was with Cory for almost two years but the laid-back restaurateur – who bears a striking resemblance to Harry – began to tire of her alleged 'prima donna-like behavior', a well-placed source told the Daily Mail. Pictured inset is Meghan and Cory together before their split in 2016.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Meghan Markle's chef ex is 'expecting his first child' with girlfriend

item.title: Elysée denies President Macron bought Prince Harry a 007-themed lighter as a wedding gift
item.description: It was claimed yesterday that French President Emmanuel Macron plans to send the British Royal a cigarette lighter as a wedding gift.
item.dc:abstract: It was claimed yesterday that French President Emmanuel Macron plans to send the British Royal a cigarette lighter as a wedding gift. French heritage brand ST Dupont announced on May 10 that their James Bond-themed gift-kit would be Macron's official wedding present to Prince Harry. The exclusive gift-kit includes a golden 007 lighter and a cigar cutter, as well as pens and cuff-links.
item.dc:creator: Sarah D Malm
item.mi:shortTitle: Elysée denies Macron bought Harry a 007-themed lighter as a gift
